title.value: Black-Box Access is Insufficient for Rigorous AI Audits
title.justification: The title is explicitly provided at the very beginning of the document.
title.quote: Black-Box Access is Insufficient for Rigorous AI Audits

extractions.description: This paper examines the limitations of black-box audits and highlights the advantages of white-box and outside-the-box audits in AI systems. The paper argues for the necessity of transparent and thorough audits that go beyond black-box methodologies to ensure more rigorous scrutiny and understanding of AI systems. Various issues like technical, physical, and legal safeguards for performing these audits with minimal security risks are discussed, drawing conclusions on the adequacy of different forms of access for effective AI audits.

type.justification: The paper primarily discusses conceptual frameworks and theoretical insights regarding the different types of audits and their limitations and advantages rather than conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: In this paper, we examine the limitations of black-box audits and the advantages of white- and outside-the-box audits.

name.justification: The paper focuses on auditing AI systems, a crucial aspect of AI governance, discussing how different access levels impact governance through audits.
name.quote: External audits of AI systems are increasingly recognized as a key mechanism for AI governance.

name.justification: A significant portion of the paper examines the security considerations associated with different types of AI audits.
name.quote: CCS Concepts: • Security and privacy → Social aspects of security and privacy;

name.justification: The article discusses the role of white-box audits in improving the interpretability and explainability of AI models.
name.quote: White-box interpretability tools aid in diagnostics.
